children.value: The OpenSumi extension supports extensions in both Browser and Node environments. Generally, we recommend that you only register views at the Browser entry and write extension business logic in the Node entry.

properties.ariaLabel: front end and back end communication permalink

children.value: Considering the above scenario, I want to pop up an error message when the button is clicked. This requires declaring a button in the left area of the extension at the Browser entry and implementing the logic to pop up the error message in the Node entry of the extension.
Declare where and how components are rendered in
In this code, we declare a view whose rendering position is the position of the left sidebar.
In the component, we bind an event handler to the button, and call the method from
when clicked (please note that this is a proxy of the extension Node entry API, this code will not be directly in the running in a Node environment).
At the same time, we also bind an
method in the Browser entry, which can also be called in the subsequent Node entry code.
// Call the `updateTitle` method registered in the Leftview component
function to register a method named

In this way, the method of the Node entry can be called through the front end in the OpenSumi extension, and you can also encapsulate complex logic in the extension of the Node environment to avoid running too many tasks in the UI extension and causing the interface to freeze.
At the same time, we need to obtain the front-end methods bound through

In addition to the above methods, you can also use the more familiar
mechanism to achieve front-end and back-end communication. Command is a very important and common mechanism in OpenSumi and VS Code. Use
two methods To register and execute commands, OpenSumi also provides the
method in the front-end API (in order to reduce the complexity, the
method is not provided for now). In this way, you can call the commands registered in the Node entry through
In the VS Code extension, the API can be exposed externally by returning a set of objects through the
function. For other extensions, the extension instance can be obtained through
, and these APIs can be called.

In the Node entry of the OpenSumi extension, this method can also be used to call each other, and the attribute for accessing the Node entry of the OpenSumi extension is named
, which is different from VS Code.
